bib.title: Clear-cuts detection services for the monitoring needs of the french Ministry of agriculture
bib.citation: IGARSS 2019-2019 IEEE International Geoscience and Remote Sensing Symposium …, 2019
bib.author: Kenji Osé and Rémi Cresson
bib.conference: IGARSS 2019-2019 IEEE International Geoscience and Remote Sensing Symposium
bib.abstract: In France, clear-cuts are a logging practice regulated by law under the Forest Code. The French Ministry of Agriculture, in charge of forest policies, needs exhaustive mapping methods to monitor the clear-cuts and allow its agents to efficiently take actions in the field. We present here the evolution of a clear-cut detection service relying on optical satellite data, from very high spatial resolution images to Sentinel-2 time series. Its nationwide deployment was possible due to a favorable context both technical and institutional.
